As such , underground storage is safer both directly and indirectly .1 As well as this , underground storage also prevents nuclear waste or nuclear radiation from reaching other states and as such , results in greater safety across borders .2 Further , storing all nuclear waste underground means that countries can concentrate their research and training efforts on responding to subterranean containment failures .

claim: The human right to life compels us to save as many as possible
argument_sentences:
One ought to commit the act that results in the fewest deaths , and that is to kill the one and save the five .
In light of this fact , our moral obligation is to reduce the number of people whose right to life is violated and maximize the number for whom that right is actualized .
Either the one or the five will die , and all the horrible results attached to the cessation of a human life will inevitably befall one of the groups .
However , in this thought experiment , the inescapable reality is that someones right to life will be violated .
This is the reason that we normally abhor killing : it cuts short human life .
That is to say , they have a right not to suffer an untimely death .
Most people would even go so far as to say that , by virtue of being conscious creatures , human beings deserve to live .
We have good reasons to value keeping people alive : it allows people the opportunity to enjoy their time on Earth and effect changes to everyones benefit , even if that simply means being around for our loved ones .

claim: A utilitarian approach will result in a decision that saves the largest number of lives possible.

True , people also experience unhappy times , and they sometimes negatively affect others , but in all but an exceptionally small number of cases , the net contribution of a human life to total utility is positive -LRB- indeed , if it werent , we probably wouldnt consider death to be bad -RRB- .
Every time a life is extinguished , some amount of present and future good vanishes from the world .
All the good things that that person would have experienced joy , accomplishment , delight will no longer occur .
debate_name: This House would kill one to save many

claim: Give a choice, all rational individuals would prefer to live in a world in which behaviour prefered the choice to sacrifice one to save many

Every single person who will ever exist is placed in this situation at the beginning of the universe .
They do not know what their level of intelligence , personality traits , gender , socioeconomic status , race or religion will be , nor even when or where they will be born ; they are behind the veil of ignorance .
In such a situation , all rational human beings would ensure that they are treated fairly no matter who they are ; they will have perfect sympathy for every human being ever , because they could end up being that person .
Next , these human beings are told they will decide which rules will govern human conduct when they come to inhabit the world .
So how would people in this hypothetical treat the decision whether to kill one to save five ?

After all , any given person is five times as likely to end up as a member of the five rather than as the one .
Rational actors would agree on the rule to kill the one and save the five .
Thus , behind the veil of ignorance , the rational human being would proudly prescribe Save the five and kill the one .
debate_name: This House would kill one to save many

claim: An English Parliament would Increase MPs Accountability.
argument_sentences:

claim: Restricting arms sales would restrict war and oppression by rogue states.
